abstract: The New York Times's A.O. Scott writes that J. C. Chandor's film "is a tale of greed, vanity, myopia and expediency that is all the more damning for its refusal to moralize."
snippet: The New York Times's A.O. Scott writes that J. C. Chandor's film "is a tale of greed, vanity, myopia and expediency that is all the more damning for its refusal to moralize."
